intro: Angophora woodsiana, commonly known as the narrow-leaved angophora, is a species of flowering plant in the myrtle family, Myrtaceae. It is native to eastern Australia, particularly found in the coastal regions of New South Wales and Queensland. This shrub or small tree typically grows to a height of 3–8 meters and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, red or pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by woody capsules containing seeds. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
